title: rustc breaks when jemalloc is configured with abort:true,junk:true,redzone:true

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
```
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Debian GNU/Linux testing-updates (sid)

$ dpkg -l | grep Rust
ii  cargo                                 0.8.0-2                              amd64        Rust package manager
ii  libstd-rust-1.8:amd64                 1.8.0+dfsg1-1                        amd64        Rust standard libraries
ii  libstd-rust-dev:amd64                 1.8.0+dfsg1-1                        amd64        Rust standard libraries - development files
ii  rust-gdb                              1.8.0+dfsg1-1                        amd64        Rust debugger (gdb)
ii  rustc                                 1.8.0+dfsg1-1                        amd64        Rust systems programming language

$ rustc -V
rustc 1.8.0
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 1 byte before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 2 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 3 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 4 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 5 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 6 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 7 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 8 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 9 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 10 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 11 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 12 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 13 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 14 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 15 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 16 bytes before 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 0 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 1 byte after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 2 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 3 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 4 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 5 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 6 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 7 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 8 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 9 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 10 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 11 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 12 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 13 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 14 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 15 bytes after 0x7feffac50188 (size 8), byte=0x5a
Aborted (core dumped)

$ ls /etc/malloc.conf
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 33 Jul  8  2015 /etc/malloc.conf -> abort:true,junk:true,redzone:true
```

Same if I try to compile something:

```
$ rustc a.rs
<jemalloc>: Corrupt redzone 1 byte before 0x7fbf010228b8 (size 8), byte=0x5a
...
Aborted (core dumped)
```

@bluss tested other combinations with similar results so doesn't look like it's Debian specific: 
https://travis-ci.org/bluss/rust-itertools/builds/125225098
